text:
Error Log shows (32)Broken pipe: core_output_filter: writing data to the network

This is happening ALOT of times in a day.
creator: dxmwml@rit.edu

text:
This could just be clients hitting the "stop" button or otherwise
stopping the loading of the page.  Do you have reasons to believe
otherwise?
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
I've been having the same problem here. What is really strange is that there is 
not a corresponding entry in the accesslog, just the error-log.
Also, even if clients would press the stop button in there browser, this should 
not happen, but the server should generate a 206-error, and write the to the 
accesslog.
creator: info@orangexl.com
slive@apache.org
text: This doesn't seem like a bug to me.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
errr. Just FYI: 206 is not an error, it's the appropriate status code for range
responses.
